alert.note: Alert for Iron; Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 2:03PM MDT until August 10 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN IRON, WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 203 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated ongoing thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing across Zion NP. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar, automated gauges, National Park personnel and river gauges. Park rangers reported numerous large waterfalls in the park, and the Virgin River at Virgin flows increased from 77 cfs to 1604 cfs in one hour. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park, La Verkin, Virgin, Springdale, Rockville and Kolob Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
